arts.ttl: Why Thomas Frank's authority is now in question after spoilt brats Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence snubbed him following Chelsea defeat, writes OLIVER HOLT - while humiliated Xavi Simons is showing shades of Florian Wirtz
arts.sum: OLIVER HOLT: The most worrying image of a worrying evening for Spurs fans occurred in the seconds after the final whistle.

arts.ttl: How Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca stumped Thomas Frank's long throw strategy with innovative tactic in win over Spurs... so, has the blueprint been set after Premier League surge?
arts.sum: Daily Mail Sport 's KIERAN GILL kept a watchful eye over the London derby and took note of how Enzo Maresca tactically managed to outfox Frank - and stump Tottenham's threat from set-pieces.

arts.ttl: Did Spurs players refuse to applaud fans after Chelsea defeat?
arts.sum: Match of the Day's Gabby Logan, Alan Shearer and Ashley Williams dissect the reaction of Tottenham's Djed Spence and Micky van de Ven after their defeat by Chelsea.

arts.ttl: Pedro goal gives Chelsea deserved win over lacklustre Tottenham
arts.sum: Joao Pedro ends his 10-game goal drought to give Chelsea a deserved victory as Tottenham were booed off after another dismal home performance.

arts.ttl: Chelsea’s crash tackle king exposes Tottenham’s confused mess of a team | Barney Ronay
arts.athr: Barney Ronay at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium
arts.sum: Spurs resemble a pile of sticks leaning against a wall with the rampaging Moisés Caicedo happy to dismantle them Sitting through this tightly stitched but still oddly shapeless game of football, you kept thinking: what does this remind me of? The trapped energy, the collisions. The sense of something always but never really happening. Oh yes. Watching the full 90 minutes of Chelsea’s narrow but still comfortable 1-0 defeat of Tottenham was like staring at one of those hypnotic drunken city centre brawls that appear on social media from time to time, where nothing ever really seems to start or stop, where the whole things is just a kind of tortured flailing, but one that must also be pored over endlessly in the comments. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Awkward moment two Tottenham stars are spotted BLANKING Thomas Frank after they were BOOED off by angry fans following Chelsea defeat - as boss responds to snub
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL AT TOTTENHAM HOTSPUR STADIUM: Thomas Frank admitted he was 'massively hurt' to have managed Tottenham's lowest-ever expected-goals total.

arts.ttl: Thomas Frank responds to Spurs duo’s snub after Chelsea defeat
arts.sum: Thomas Frank has played down being ignored by Spurs players Djed Spence and Micky van de Van on the pitch after Saturday’s home defeat to Chelsea. The hosts put in an uninspiring performance against their London rivals as they fell to a 34th-minute goal from Joao Pedro at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. Spurs fans vented […] The post Thomas Frank responds to Spurs duo’s snub after Chelsea defeat first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Tottenham vs. Chelsea Player Ratings: Vicario on form but problems continue at home for Spurs
arts.sum: GK Guglielmo Vicario Distribution was not great but had a good game in goal. Kept the score down and made some particularly good saves towards the end of each h

arts.ttl: Tottenham were devoid of ideas vs. Chelsea, and fans are turning on Thomas Frank
arts.sum: Tottenham looked feckless and devoid of ideas against Chelsea, such that coach Thomas Frank seems to be losing Spurs fans.

arts.ttl: Tottenham Hotspur 0-1 Chelsea: The Blues dominate as they defeat Tottenham once again
arts.sum: As expected, Chelsea were enjoying plenty of the ball in the early stages of the encounter, but Thomas Frank's side looked more than happy for this to be the case. It was yet again Chelsea who emerged victorious against bitter rivals Tottenham Hotspur, with Joao Pedro's first-half strike being enough to win it for Enzo Maresca's side.
